question_text: Why is it called a 'dual inline' memory module?
answer_options: It includes two chips per module.
It supports dual channel memory by default.
It has electrical contacts on both sides of the module, each with a separate signal path.
It is used in systems with two CPUs.
correct_answer: It has electrical contacts on both sides of the module, each with a separate signal path.
explanation: The term 'dual inline' refers to separate signal paths on both sides of the module, increasing capacity and efficiency.
